newsitem.title: PANAMA: Ecuador's Bucaram to get more security in Panama.
newsitem.headline: Ecuador's Bucaram to get more security in Panama.

text.p: Panama's government has offered to boost security around ousted Ecuadorean President Abdala Bucaram after he received a bomb threat on Saturday, a spokesman for the former leader said.
Bucaram changed the location of a strategy meeting with political supporters after receiving the threat on Saturday in a Panama City hotel, Carlos Bustamante told reporters.
"We received a call about a bomb threat at the hotel. A bomb squad arrived with dogs but nothing was found," Bustamante said. "The Panamanian government offered protection to Bucaram."
Security officials at the Plaza Paitilla Hotel where the meeting was to be held denied there was a a bomb threat, but confirmed to Reuters that dogs did sniff the premises.
"We have our own security and team of dogs for routine checks when there are high-profile guests, especially for someone as controversial as Bucaram," said one security official.

Bucaram moved the meeting with 53 political supporters to a restaurant adjacent to the hotel to plan a re-election campaign and create a strategy to file a conspiracy lawsuit against interim President Fabian Alarcon.
Bucaram moved to Panama on Feb. 17 after being dismissed by Ecuador's Congress for "mental incompetence."
Ecuador's Supreme Court initiated criminal proceedings against Bucaram, and issued arrest warrants against three former aides.
Bucaram lived in exile in Panama from 1985-90 after he fled Ecuador when he was charged with corruption as mayor of Guayaquil.
